sentences: Olen selle püssiga nii mõnegi rebase pikali sirutanud
Põder paiskas hundi oma esijalaga pikali
translation: to let go of/past active participle of laskma
context: The Estonian word 'lasknud' is the past connegative and past active participle form of the verb 'laskma'. It can mean several things depending on context: 1) to have shot (when referring to firing a weapon), 2) to let go/released, or 3) laid down/fell. In the examples provided, it shows how this word is used in different contexts - from hunting ('sirutanud' meaning 'shot') to people lying down or objects falling.
